docs.snippet: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 29 -- Syria has reopened her doors to tourists and other visitors from the United States and Britain. Tourist agencies here said that citizens of both countries were being given visas at the border as they cross from Lebanon....
docs.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 29 -- Syria has reopened her doors to tourists and other visitors from the United States and Britain. Tourist agencies here said that citizens of both countries were being given visas at the border as they cross from Lebanon.
docs.abstract: Tourists and other visitors from US and GB being issued visas at borders as they cross from Lebanon; Amers, Brit and W Gers had been barred since '67 Mideast war, but curbs on W Ger tourists were lifted 3 mos ago; new moves linked to completion of internatl airport for which there is practically no traffic and coming opening of Damascus Internatl Fair

headline.main: Syria Is Admitting Americans Again; '67 Ban Rescinded; SYRIA ADMITTING VISITORS FROM U.S.

byline.original: By DANA ADAMS SCHMIDTSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: Cetusa, a sponsor of a State Department work/travel program, was reviewed after 400 participants staged a walkout at a Hershey packing plant....
docs.lead_paragraph: Cetusa, a sponsor of a State Department work/travel program, was reviewed after 400 participants staged a walkout at a Hershey packing plant.
docs.abstract: State Department bans prominent Council for Educational Travel, USA, from bringing foreign students to the United States for summer jobs; hopes to send message to dozens of private companies participating in the work program that they will have to monitor foreign students far more closely to ensure that they are not being exploited as cheap workers; move follows incident in which 400 foreign students walked out of abusive jobs they had been assigned to at a Hershey's plant.

headline.seo: Company Banned by State Department in Effort to Protect Foreign Students
headline.main: Company Banned in Effort to Protect Foreign Students From Exploitation
headline.print_headline: Company Banned in Effort to Protect Foreign Students From Exploitation

docs.snippet: PEIPING, Aug, 23--A group of forty-one young Americans, looking fresh and chipper after a nine-day train journey across Siberia, arrived here today. They were greeted by cheering Chinese youths who almost mobbed them....
